Author: pandthu
Review: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is a prime example of a lackluster sequel that fails to capture the charm and excitement of its predecessor. Despite having high hopes for this film, it ultimately falls flat in almost every aspect.

Author: timeblank
Review: Some good points, Seeing the quantum world was amazing, secondly introducing Kang the Conqueror was great. He was intimidating and persuasive. But I do have concerns, Oh my goodness, what happened to MODOK! Wow they made him painfully goofy. The injustice with Kang and his war. It was painfully disappointing on how it concluded.

Author: rokchik07
Review: Good grief!! If you enjoy watching actors running around a 5 metre squared green room, whist the rest of the film is created around them via CGI, then this film is for you!!! No story and definitely not substance!! How can there be a story when they're just clearly running back and forth in one room?!? Too reliant on CGI, and trying too hard to be Star Wars!!!!! The visuals are not impressive and it just doesn't grab you in the slightest - I'm that bored, I'm writing the review whilst it's still on!! I love Paul Rudd (the only reason I watch the Ant Man movies) but even him and the ever fabulous Bill Murray can't save this movie!! CGI OVERLOAD!! :-(

Author: keremozkan-76561
Review_Title: More plot holes than an overused hillbilly underwear
Review:
I know some will suggest that
what I write is overly critical but even my 12 yr old daughter kept rolling her eyes at the stupidity of the story line and the lameness of the overall dialogue. The characters other than Ant-Man and the Wasp were sadly so over the top and impossible to believe. Once again watching this latest Hollywood so-called block buster you get a sense it was written for someone with an IQ of 13 and most importantly The Bad Guys just have about the worst aim ever... when it come time to shooting our heros from a distance of six feet. And also the ending why oh why must all Marvel directors feel the obligation to indicate blatantly that another (obviously unnecessary) sequel is on the way just to make a buck. As my grandpa used to say even though you put dog poop on good bread and serve it up with top condiments you are still gonna eat crap.

Author: imxhill
Review_Title: Basically Marvel's Worst moments stitched together with Fun moments of the old days.
Review:
The first half of Ant-Man and the Wasp:
Quantumania is REALLY bad. The writing, the directing, the visuals, and the performances all range from mediocre to straight up awful.

Author: StormyLines
Review: Based on the mixed reviews we almost waited for it to come to Disney+. But I'm glad we saw it in theaters instead! It was much better than I thought it would be, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. With the past few marvel movies like Thor and Black Panther being just alright I was totally prepared for this movie to be the same way, but I was pleasantly surprised. It was exciting, funny, thrilling, interesting and not at all boring, and there being a quantum realm civilization down there with people living in it was somehow more believable than the underwater city in Black Panther Wakanda forever. I recommend giving it a shot but I don't think everyone will like it.

Author: alwaysacuriousfan
Review_Title: Why are MCU movies incredibly disappointing now?
Review: The movie pacing is pretty bad. The characters should have been better developed so when things happen to them, we, as audiences, actually care especially with Cassie. Who even hired her? The actress has no charisma and no chemistry with the other actors, I can't get invested in her and Scott's relationship. Her face also doesn't move? She is not very expressive and the delivery of her lines is just not landing very well. I didn't see Kang as a legitimate foe. I think he was wasted in this movie. If you didn't watch Loki, one would care even less in his character. AND WHAT WAS UP WITH THAT MOVING GIANT HEAD?! That was so weird. I could not take it (?) seriously. I didn't care much for this movie. It didn't make me feel anything for the characters except, maybe, annoyance.

Author: Doctor_Dafaria
Review_Title: Movie full of wasted potential and useless gags
Review: It's clear that a lot of studio influence and producers has heavily influenced this script where a movie that meant to upstart the saga's main villain, ended underplaying the stakes by making it a generic guardians of the galaxy rip off with humorless gags and middle school tier level writing that an average mediocre English teacher can see through.

Author: disnotbetty-10195
Review_Title: Totally beyond ridiculous ....just one big CGI mess!
Review: Scott Lang is not only a Avenger, but also a successful author of a best selling book. Scott's daughter Cassie is now a teenager and a activists for human rights and a scientist.

Author: bobtahar
Review_Title: Quantumania is pure Sci-fi and it is magical!
Review: Love it.... LOVE IT!!! I love Sci-fi... even the obscure low budget foreign Sci-fi movies. Quantumania is pure Sci-fi and it is magical!

Author: archanademonia
Review_Title: Majors carrying the movie almost by himself
Review: Okay, so what did the writers take before writing this script? This is poor coming from Marvel, and someone is trying to be funny like Taika Waititi but failing hard. Instead of laughing of scenes that I am sure were supposed to be funny, there were a lot of headshaking because things were just BIZARRE.

Author: eh_ustun
Review: This film had quite a lot that I liked about it but also quite a lot that I disliked. Nevertheless, the bad was just small things so my rating is still fairly higher than what I expected to give this.

Author: tresm87
Review_Title: Another Quantum leap backwards for the faltering MCU with one of the worst villain portrayals in quite some time.
Review: The days of MCU mania seem to be desperately hanging in the balance due to ridiculous forced comedy and terrible casting decisions. While still leagues better than the abhorrent eternals, and aboit on par with the terribly underwhelming love and thunder, ant man 3 doesn't do much to break out if the consistent mediocrity of the MCU in the last few years. The film tries so hard to do so much that the world building isn't even memorable for future films. The casting decision of Jonathan Majors as Kang is about the worst I've seen for the franchise. This guy has no place being a classic marvel villain and doesn't come close to being even serviceable. Easily the worst aspect of the mediocre film. The MCU is officially in MAJOR(S) trouble.

Author: super_kjeld
Review: This movie is fun and has some good bombastic action scenes. Kang is portrayed very well, however we might need more of a backstory in the future. The science fiction world for me had some Star Wars vibes. The main cast also did a good job, they are funny but not Thor L&T level over the top. But it also shows the power of these underrated avengers. What I don't like is that every MCU movie is now an introduction movie of someone new. We need a movie which ties some of the Phase 4 together, it is such a mess with all those open plot lines... And when we see the next movies on the horizon this will not change in the near future.

Author: aliabbas334
Review_Title: I love Paul Rudd but this was garbage
Review: This is good. Finally and slowly I am getting done with Marvel. It's the same formula over and over again. They tried to copy Thor Ragnarok and tried to make the movie trippy. They got the CGI army like Endgame. They got the funny weird character like Jeff Goldblum but nothing worked. Not even a stellar cast like Rudd himself, Michael Douglas, Michelle Pfeiffer and Bill Murray could save this movie.i am getting done with Marvel. I think time to give DC a chance now.

Author: IBlackI
Review: Really, what is this? Because everything I saw in the whole movie, were not only stupid jokes, but also the poor direction and the script that was, let's say that it was bad the script falls short, what means "this" for Marvel, for D I S N E Y, seriously people do not get tired of this aberrant crap? Because the only thing that's good in this movie is where Jonathan Majors appears.

Author: chaayareehal
Review: The story started with Antman being famous and even releasing his own book VERY ORIGINAL! Then Cassie ( Antman's daughter ) in less then 10 minutes from the start of the movie transported the whole family into the quantum realm. Apparently Janet ( Hope's Mum ) had this very extreme past and in this realm making the whole story more and more complicated. The amount of people's information was very unnecessary for the story. Finally after two hours watching this in 4d was a whole waste of money, the only thing that had potential is Cassie a girl with some good energy and personality. This is really disappointing for the marvel movies after all of this.

Author: hbfs-26875
Review: The story of the movie is relatively simple, but what sets it apart is its seamless and complete narrative. Kang's stays faithful to the comic book setting, though the balance of power among the characters may not be entirely even. Overall, it is an excellent popcorn movie that I would give a 9 out of 10, largely due to its outstanding cast. Although it may lack a bit in terms of humor, the storytelling is very rich and engaging. The film takes the audience on a thrilling adventure with a well-executed plot that keeps them invested until the very end. It also features some jaw-dropping action sequences that are visually stunning and guaranteed to leave the viewers on the edge of their seats.

Author: daap86
Review: The thing that bothered me the most is that the Quantum Realm si supposed to be out of space and time but it works exactly as our space and time, with the exact same laws.

Author: belikerev-532-859651
Review: This movie left me feeling underwhelmed and disappointed.

Author: JCinHB
Review: Well..... where to begin???

Author: varnium
Review: This movie is in fact the best Ant Man movie ever. Not many people understand the concept of space-time continuum or quantum physics. But Marvel surely integrated those concepts with this Ant Man movie.

Author: Mr-Fusion
Review: In all of my online circles, this movie has been getting savaged, which does plenty for lowering expectations. I don't share their animosity, but I'm super glad I didn't pay to see it in theaters. "Quantumania" is messy, it's garish, it's . . . God, it's boring.

Author: a-damkjer
Review_Title: Weak incoherent story with lots of unnecessary effects
Review: I really struggled to keep the focus in trying to find any coherence. The storyline is shifting around as a ship drifting without sails or anchor and the "universe" is confusing - not because it is the quantum realm. Quite contrary - it could as well be some strange world that the Star Lord is visiting on one of his adventures.

Author: hjvergara
Review_Title: An unimaginative and familiar trip to the Quantum Realm
Review: "Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania" is directed to a rather disappointing, unimaginative, and uncreative "seen-it-all-before" formula by Peyton Reed, who also helmed the first two installments in the Ant-Man series. It's not a terrible movie, and I'm sure many viewers will be entertained and wowed by the world building inside the Quantum Realm. But I was sadly underwhelmed as I was hoping for a different type of realm: one that is truly unique, different, out-of-this-world, and even hard to grasp and understand. Instead, I felt it was a rather dimly-lit, messy place that could still exist within the constructs of our understanding of physics and the world we inhabit. In other words, this didn't feel like a different dimension. It didn't feel otherworldly. And there are missed opportunities to build and make our visit to the Quantum Realm a weird, magical, and truly trippy awe-inspiring ride.

Author: phillhudson
Review_Title: SPOILERS Mostly Good Film. Few Nitpicks
Review: First: things I want to add or change. This Kang is actually He Who Remains from Loki. He does escape, because why not? He kills all the other timelines and then "retires" after creating the TVA. He does not live in a linear line, so make him the guy from Loki Season 1. Bill Murray appears but the film forgets him. Like it forgot Scott's friends from the two previous films. Bill Murray could have appeared later in the film, like have him be MODOK's immediate supervisor. Scott's friends could have had scenes where they tweek with Cassie's device and that is how the team gets home. I also wish MODAK wasn't Darren. Just make him a Quantum native.

Author: danionme
Review: The acting and humor in the movie felt forced and some of the jokes were inappropriate. Additionally, there were some parts of the plot that didn't make much sense or were difficult to believe. While I understand that it's fiction, it's still important to create a sense of believability within the story. For example, during the scene where the characters are being sucked into the quantum realm, it would have made more sense for them to use their powers to protect themselves or their loved ones. Overall, while I personally didn't enjoy this movie, I believe it's important to express criticism in a constructive and respectful way that doesn't attack others or their opinions.

Author: asalock
Review: I didn't expect much from the movie as I've found that Antman isn't the best avenger but I was still disappointed.

Author: evan_lassi
Review: That's basically what the MCU just made. After the build up from Loki, I was really excited to see how this would go. But then the reviews came out and kept coming so I decided to wait. Smart decision because wow this isn't good.

Author: cthirlby
Review: Was really hyped for this one, the start of phase 5 and kicking it off with a finally serious ant-man movie with Kang! I was most excited for Kang in this one and I got what I wanted so I'm happy. Ant-Man getting a serious movie was very different but really cool to see him taking a situation fully seriously in his own movie. Modok is in this movie and I know Modok from the shows and comics so his look I knew it would look odd as it's hard to pull that off in love action and take it seriously but I'm happy with what they did with the design, also all the jokes with him when he died and in general were hilarious. Cassie Lang is all grown up and gets some screen time, she had a cute relationship with her dad but apart from that I didn't get super excited for her, or any other characters besides Ant-Man and Kang really. Ant-Man you get to see at his peak of sorts with him fully capable of using his powers and able to grow to immense sizes, he held his own in this movie too with a brutally cool fight scene. My main takeaway and what this movie was truly about though was Kang and thank god cause I love Kang! His attitude and personality showing how cunning, dangerous and intelligent he is makes me even more into him as a character. Love the design of the suit and seeing what he is capable of. All the lore for Kang too and the multiverse war I ate up! Loved it loved it loved it! It's just the way he operates that makes him so badass! Unfortunately when he died (I think) I was like damn that sucks I loved that variant but the end credits with the council of Kangs!!! YES! Can't wait to see them all and more Kang screen time, love that character. I got a tiny bit annoyed at how often the characters removed their helmets purely just to not hide the stars faces which happened a lot but it's not a massive issue. Overall I enjoyed Ant-Man mostly for Kang (I'm saying Kang a lot whoops) but he was really such a rich character to dive into so I'm glad there was a lot of that.

Author: kristian-howald
Review_Title: Quantumania: A Quantum Realm Rollercoaster that Doesn't Quite Hit the Mark
Review: We took a family trip into Quantumania, the newest installment of Ant-Man and The Wasp series. Honestly? We came away with feelings as mixed as a quantum entanglement. Yes, it offered some chuckles and kept us mildly entertained, but it lacked that special something that makes a Marvel movie, well, a Marvel movie.

Author: mesaxi
Review: This movie as really just there to introduce Kang, who is really a poor choice of villain for the next phase of the MCU. For the most part it just felt like going through the motions of a Superhero movie. They also set up a torch-pass for Kathryn Newton to take over as some form of Ant person. The weird "activism" theme they put into the movie was so half-hearted and lame, it gave me douche-chills.

Author: Riz11
Review: It was a generic super hero movie, big bad guy we must beat up who wants destroy the world. No real back story on Kang, except he was exiled to quantum realm. Kang is supposedly extremely powerful, he has defeated thor and avengers in other multiverses yet gets defeated by large ants, then has a fist fight with ant man without the suit. The quantum realm wasnt really a factor or multiverse for that matter, it didn't really play any major role in the movie, besides multiple ant men piled together so ant man could reach the multiverse travel sphere. Attempts at humour were terrible, best part of the movie were scenes after the end credits with multiple kangs from different timelines and the loki scene where they show a scientist version of kang. So much could have been done with multiverses and quantum realm, yet this is just a brainless smash em up movie. Very disappointing.

Author: anasrafique-59355
Review_Title: Awesome, i love it, phase five begun with a masterpiece.
Review: My spoiler free review of Ant-man & the Wasp: Quantumania. The headlines read "Quantamania joins Eternals as the 2nd rotten MCU film!" but the thing is, I like eternals.

Author: katharineshowalter
Review: The Ant Man movies have been distinguished by light plots, generic villains (even for the MCU), and odd riffs that, while not always very funny, were welcome in their weirdness. But with this movie, aside from an slapdash attempt to include M. O. D. O. K., all of that weirdness is gone. More than any other MCU film so far, this feels like just a Disney movie.

Author: markleachsa-1
Review: My first reaction: hang on, physics doesn't work like that. But I put that aside, as I wanted so, so badly to like this movie. Paul Rudd is an amusing and likeable chap, even though the jokes and dialogue between him and his quantam-travelling family were old and heavy and stale, without a spark of spontaneity.

Author: tpcatoz-90650
Review: When I saw all these negative reviews I thought people were just being pessimistic or just nit picking. Unfortunately, they were right. I wanted to like this movie and I was pretty excited going in. I didn't expect a life changing movie but I expected a solid marvel movie, the movies we got leading up to Endgame.

Author: nicholasvalenzuela
Review: I went to watch this movie during discount Tuesday, with my mom and little sister. During the movie nothing really happened between us barely any talking/jokes. Throughout the movie I found my self laughing pretty hard, it was a really funny movie, and such an upgrade from the last one. The plot of the movie could've been a little more and there could've visualized a little more at steak but that's just a suggestion (doesn't need to be fixed or anything) The visuals were amazing, and I really enjoyed the editing style. Everyone else rated the movie 8-8.5 they thought it was hilarious but a little stupid at times.

Author: henry8-3
Review_Title: Ant Man and the Wasp: Quantumania
Review: Due to a gizmo that Ant Man's daughter, Cassie has created, the whole team end up in the Quantum realm facing any number of weird and wonderful creatures who all live in fear of Kang the Conqueror who is also stuck there because Michelle Pfeiffer messed it up for him when she was there previously and now she's back, he's out to get her and hopefully escape the quantum realm and destroy trillions of people for lols.

Author: rmadelineolson
Review_Title: I made an IMDb to make this review
Review: I made an IMDb so I could rate this movie, it was that bad. I will never get those 2+ hours of my life back. I love Paul Rudd, but I just couldn't handle how cringey this movie was. From the awful special effects to the awful humor, it really felt like marvel had just started phoning it in. I couldn't believe how much MODOK looked like that one floating guy from the spy kids mocked. Is anything and everything canon in marvel now? They can just do whatever they want because they're exploring the multiverse? This review had to be 600 characters so I've had to ramble. Anyway, they used a volume for the movie and you could tell.

Author: portreathmonkey
Review: Very boring. My friends said it was bad so i watched thinking it would be fun bad. It was not. 2 hours if my life im never getting back. Acting from everyone but Rudd was poor and the plot was full of terrible conviniences and the amount of plot armour on the character was astounding. The only joke I laughed at was the design of MODOK. The cgi is so bad it is absurd and he looked goofy unlike the comic version who looked menacing. MODOK killed literally no one even though his name has the word kill in it and he was defeated by a little girl who has never used her powers before. Kang was terrible and just there for the sake of a villain. His power flipped from dimension shattering to getting overpowered by ants. He is going to be the next big villain and I dont care about him.

Author: nielw
Review: Loki S1 is probably one of my favorite entries in the MCU, mostly because of Kang. I've been looking forward to his formal entry into the MCU with this movie for some time. Kang is easily the best part of the whole thing.

Author: dlinderman-55448
Review_Title: Kang Can't Quite Conquer Average Film
Review: First of all - Jonathan Majors as Kang is gold.

Author: ojsjlb
Review: Ant Man stand alone films have always been a classic cringe fest in terms of cheese jokes and one liners and they held up as passable, but we are in way too deep in this universe to keep voiding the tension and stakes by eye rolling the kiddy dialogue.

Author: maximusnewton
Review_Title: Why do they do this to ant-man😭😭😭
Review: I was totally disappointed in the story board writers.this was ment to be a emotional movie but the emotions did not connected with us atleast not that effectively. Clearly the story board writers of Marvel became lazy.jonathen mayers and Paul rudd are the only ones saving this movie from utter disaster.

Author: ErReads
Review_Title: Very Entertaining and fun. Loved seeing the support and warmth of the Ant-Man family!
Review: Despite some storyline choppiness, I thought this was a thoroughly fun and entertaining film. All of the central characters are very engaging to watch. Paul Rudd had great father-daughter chemistry with Kathryn Newton. Jonathan Majors is great as the villain. And I even liked most of the new side characters, including a red blob-like creature, a telepath and a warrior woman.

Author: sarwarh789
Review_Title: okay film to watch nothing special.
Review: After watching this movie, I'm glad I was around and was enjoying watching Marvel at its best. (Phases One to Three). Everything now and moving forward is just going downhill, production, acting, script, direction, and storytelling. This movie was okay nothing spectacular, again great for kids/teens these days so perhaps they may enjoy it more. Ant-man the original was a far better, relatable film with a really good storyline.

Author: ottomartinsen
Review: Ant-Man and The Wasp: Quantumania was not bad bad, But it was bad. This Movie really was boring and Strange. The only Good Thing about this Movie was Kang The Conqueror.

Author: debo-awesomeness
Review_Title: I am no longer looking forward to the Kang Dynasty
Review: This movie felt so hollow to me, nothing was real, and it's a shame because the setting of being in quantum microverse is such a unexplored setting in mainstream sci-fi. It's not just that all of the sets were CGI, it's the same technology used in the Mandalorian and Avatar 2 just came out and they used CGI very nicely with a lot of attention to detail. On top of the bad looks and bad use of setting, it's that they waste the best looking Kang variant in such a nothing plot. There wasn't anything telling the audience that Kang was a calculating menace outside of some predictable exposition and him being half decent at lying. I really disliked how this Kang gets defeated so easily and then the post credit scenes show off some of the ugliest and cheesiest looking variants.

Author: dmbrezjr
Review: This movie was not as bad as everyone is claiming. Is it of the same caliber as Lord of the Rings.... No. However, based on them having to make a movie about Antman and the Wasp, while at the same time having to set up the next phase of Marvel, I thought they did a great job. It was a fun movie and the visuals I thought were great.

Author: Entertainmentsparadise
Review: Ant-Man and The Wasp: Quantummainia was very mid. There were no highs nor lows, and I felt like I was driving Ms. Daisy around. What was the point?

Author: tchitouniaram
Review:
Unfortunately...But , if first one was really good , second film reasonably good , this one is just not too bad... Not interesting story made me basically to fall asleep in the middle ,and the rest I was on the phone )))Which definitely shows how boring this movie was...
600???(((
Unfortunately...But , if first one was really good , second film reasonably good , this one is just not too bad... Not interesting story made me basically to fall asleep in the middle ,and the rest I was on the phone )))Which definitely shows how boring this movie was...Unfortunately...But , if first one was really good , second film reasonably good , this one is just not too bad... Not interesting story made me basically to fall asleep in the middle ,and the rest I was on the phone )))Which definitely shows how boring this movie was...

Author: farthing-55458
Review: Me and my two boys 18 & 15 were excited to check this one out, but let me tell you, we all left extremely underwhelmed. Walking out to the car my boys were literally laughing at the movie, and said, "Dad, we're done with Marvel!" The movie didn't have the Antman comedy that we're all used to. It was definitely missing Peña!!! He adds so much to the Antman stories and movies. The quantum realm was a bit of a joke. Marvel/Disney seems like they're making this stuff up as they go and very poorly at that. Kang, is not a menacing villain at al lol IMO, he doesn't come across as a threat at all. The characters seemed very wooden in this installment, I don't know. It just felt off...Throwing Bill Murray in it as a cameo made it even more of a joke, and not a good one. I was expecting so much more. This movie felt like Tron, Starwars, Guardians of the Galaxy and Thor Ragnorok all in one. Those movies separately worked but throwing a collection of all them into one movie felt way off. I actually dozed off at one point myself. This movie didn't develop Kang, Janet all of sudden has all these secrets of the Quantum realm??? Darren became M. O. D. O. K??? This movie was bad on so many levels. Antman now doesn't even pass out after becoming big??? I don't know what else to say, I was not impressed at all! Best part of this movie was the second credits scene promising Season 2 of LOKI!!!

Author: vkchandu
Review: It was a good marvel movie. Ant man returned. The story was fantastic and the rise of a new hero (Cassie) was also good. I am gonna give this film a 9/10. The reason I didn't give that 1 point is due the the credit scene (Different kinds of Kangs coming from every multiverse). I think there were too many forms of Kang in the end. I could understand this is for 'Avengers 5: Kang Dynasty'. 1 single Kang was hard to defeat and way too powerful. I wonder how the Avengers are going to beat almost 1 million Kangs. Ant Man's daughter, Wasp and the other team again played an excellent role in the film. The concept of giant ants in Quantumania for the final fight was also good.

Author: geokk
Review: For the last 2-3 years Marvel has brought low quality projects to the big screen and this one was no expectation. Trust me I'm a BIG MCU fan, I love Marvel so much, but post Endgame every movie seems cheap (No Way Home being the only exception). Quantumania is definitely not what I wanted it to be, I expected a lot more from the film. It has lazy writing, cheap performances and extremely weak CGI and VFX, which was really important considering that almost all of the film is shot in front of a green/blue screen! The only thing keeping the movie from being a total disappointment is Kang! Great introduction to the character, Jonathan Majors is AMAZING! Kang suits him perfectly, I can't wait to see more of him in Phase 5 and I think you will too! Also great post and after credit scenes!

Author: Bonobo13579
Review: A serious case of diminishing (if you'll excuse the pun) returns happening now with the Marvel (P)universe. (Sorry)

Author: carterkev
Review: Sorry but I don't see this as an ant man movie. They were fun and entertaining. This is boring and annoying, where is the humour, the originality the story the characters. It's just a Mish mash of CGI effects that just are really stupid at times. This is the third actress who has played his daughter. This one looks older and is just plain annoying. Marvel have lost the plot, it's done, stop trying to make up for lack of story and originality with expensive CGI Rubbish. Michael Douglas was just wasted, it didn't seem like an ant man movie, but a CGI movie with ant man in it. You had your moment of glory with the first batch, hang it up now and leave it at that no more CGI movies please...

Author: Elvis-Del-Valle
Review_Title: A psychedelic journey through the Quantum Realm
Review: The third installment of Ant-Man takes the protagonist and company on a crazy journey through the Quantum Realm full of amazing dream scenes. As always with Marvel, the abundance of digital effects makes the film a visually stunning journey with settings, creatures, and characters reminiscent of the world of Star Wars or the wacky misadventures of Futurama. The group consisting of Paul Rudd, Evangeline Lilly, Michael Douglas, Michelle Pfeiffer and Kathryn Newton are a huge star for the film. The introduction of Kang after the Loki series is already a glimpse of what is to come in this phase 5 of the MCU, which is a very good start to start this next phase. Modok is quite a bizarre and cartoonish character, but he has a certain air of the original Modok. One detail that can be noted is that unlike the previous Ant-Man movies, there is a little less humor here and more seriousness. Even so, Scott Lang's humor continues to hold. This movie is a very good start to phase 5 and an amazing viewing experience that is endlessly entertaining. My final rating for this movie is 9/10.

Author: judaverboom
Review: Ant-Man Quantum Mania is like trying to shrink a building with a shrink ray - it's just not possible. The movie tries so hard to be funny, action-packed, and exciting, but it falls short in every aspect.

Author: josephbarros-16407
Review_Title: Its an ok movie but not as good as the first two.
Review: Looks like phase 5 is going to start off much like how phase 4 did...very poorly, which is a shame because I loved the first Ant-Man movie and the sequel, but this third outing feels like it took 3 different types of movies and stuck them together. I enjoyed the first act of the film, the 2nds act tho absolutely dipped in quality and performance and the 3rd and final act.....smh just went absolutely bat crazy and overdone with with CGI. I thought Aquaman's 3rd act was all over the place in what was going on but this was another level of "what the heck is going on".

Author: dhoneyman-94144
Review: Apart from the fact that over 90% of the film was green screen (like, the first 15mins and last 60secs weren't green screen) the film also made little to no sense!

Author: amylorensings
Review: Come on Marvel fans, they can't all be Endgame!!! This movie is great, I don't get the bad reviews at all. When I watch a Marvel movie I try to not to have any expectations, I'm just along for the ride! The only one I questioned was the Multiverse of Madness, it moved way too fast and gave me a splitting headache. Because we love the MCU we will watch any of them on repeat, including Multiverse of Madness and I will gladly watch this one again, probably multiple times.

Author: sapronova
Review: I really pains me to write this but last 2 years marvel movies went really down. I believe that writing is the fault. Story isn't interesting anymore. CGI is good, actors are the same, why is it happening? Since Stan Lee passed I think maybe Disney took another direction. Quantity over quality. Don't they see that rating drop badly and they are producing crap? Or it is just money above everything. This is just sad. If people don't go to see these movies in the cinema Disney still makes money on their channel. It is truly horrible that money is the objective here. For last decade these movies were highlights of my week or month I was so excited to wait another one to come out. And I'm not a teenager! But not anymore. Unfortunately Disney corporation reached their greed limit I'm not wasting my money on another garbage film made by them. Enough is enough!

Author: chand-suhas
Review: The new Ant-Man movie throws the entire family once again back into the quantum realm and this time a new baddie is introduced, named Kang who is in exile. The mission is to stop Kang from getting out of the quantum realm but also to save the residents of the quantum realm from him. Further the new universe they find is connected to the multiverse. How Marvel introduces their next main villain who struggles beat the ants is what the movie is all about.

Author: klc-91300
Review: I was looking forward to this. We were promised a new adventure and a new villain and this was supposed to kick it off. Well, I left the theater feeling really let down. I don't think there was one thing I enjoyed in this movie. First of all, it's 90% cgi. I absolutely pictured them in my mind while they were onscreen in bodysuits with those electrodes attached against a green screen, I could just see that instead of what was happening. The "acting " was dull and uninspiring. When I get to the end of a movie and can't remember much except there were people in it, you know it's boring. If they did recast the daughter role, they need to do it again. There's never a sense of danger throughout, especially dad and daughter scenes. Oh hey, let's have some snappy dialogue right before someone tries to kill us, and hey, let's happily hug and high five right after because we were so scared. I never felt one ounce of desperation or inspiration throughout, they were all phoning it in. And as far as introducing the new big, bad guy? What a letdown. I actually chuckled a little at the visuals of all of the versions of him breaking free because I felt no dread at all in thinking about where they were going or what they were going to do. It was a boring, cringy yawn fest that did not excite me for this next phase. They should have nabbed James Gunn to co-lead with Kevin Feige instead of letting him go to DC. I bet the next phase is going to be DC kicking Marvel's butt.

Author: Silverdashmax
Review_Title: Brilliant reintroduction to pre established characters.
Review: Despite having already seen most (if not all) of the characters in previous Marvel works, each character felt like a lot had happened to them inbetween this movie and their last appearance. As a result, many of the characters were constantly being reinvented in front of the viewers eyes.

Author: brooklynzu-84534
Review_Title: Janet, the mom is at fault
Review: All Janet had to do was sit down and talk with her family as soon as she got out and explain that there was this psycho with a Time Machine and galactic reality twisting technology, and all this would've been avoided absolutely ridiculous that a story we would rely on protective lack of information idealism she kept saying I'm trying to protect you. What a terrible way to support a plot store.

Author: CutlasSaber
Review: So I guess this movies supposed to be the start of MCU's Phase 5, and we'll, it's a pretty weak start, but a start to something nonetheless.

Author: mikeskooper
Review_Title: Falls Short of Marvel's High Standards
Review: "Ant-Man and The Wasp: Quantumania" had all the makings of a great Marvel Cinematic Universe film: a charming cast, a unique premise, and a director with a track record of success. However, the end result was a messy, unfocused film that failed to live up to its potential.

Author: mattlx
Review: I get why some critics weren't thrilled with this one. They might've expected Kang to be more intense and ruthless. But this movie's more about expanding the Marvel universe and letting Jonathan Majors show off as Kang. Still, the character's impact isn't all that remarkable.

Author: Sophiaphage
Review_Title: A Disappointing Sequel That Fails to Measure Up
Review: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is like a rollercoaster ride that forgot to go up. The movie's pacing is so sluggish, it's like the filmmakers decided to throw in a few naps for the audience. At a runtime of 118 minutes, it's about as long as an average flight to Europe, but with less excitement and worse food.

Author: imperialwalkrnyr
Review_Title: Extremely Disappointing - Could have been more
Review: While Antman & the Wasp May not be the worst Marvel movie; it is definitely the most disappointed I've been this far.

Author: weigerwu
Review: This movie is possibly the most disappointing MCU movie of all time, with it kicking off Marvel's Phase 5, it couldn't have been more underwhelming. I never imagined myself yawning during a superhero movie, yet I found myself doing so several times. It wasn't that the actors underperformed, though. Jonathan Majors was outstanding and proved himself worthy of anchoring a whole movie franchise reprising the character Kang the Conquerer. Paul Rudd pulled off an above-average performance as well. However, the plot is absolutely atrocious, the lines are awkward, and the whole movie doesn't seem to connect very well to the main MCU storyline. I couldn't have walked out the theater more disappointed.

Author: iamsini
Review_Title: F-ANT-astic!!! Movie only some minor issues.
Review: This movie feels like it would've done phase 4 some good as opposed to being the kick off for phase 5, never-the-less I think it accomplished what it set out to do, if only at the slight cost of what we love about the antman movies which is only really accomplished by having this character interact with the real world. It keeps a good family dynamic alive while giving us one of the best villain introduction comparable to Thanos if not better seeing as we get the motivation from the start. Dope visuals and cgi but shaky in some parts. M. O. D. O. K was hilarious! Kang!!!! Overall this movie was awesome!

Author: gillerner
Review: OMG this movie was soooooo boring!

Author: dryerplains
Review: Some scenes nicked from so many movies and childish scenes. I really hoped this was going to be great but it's hard to get past the 1st 25 minutes if you are looking for avengers. This is not that it's just trying to tie up loose ends and make a new stream. We shouldn't have to write an essay to let viewers know if a movie is poor just let us say yeh or neh. I'm half way through and I just can't think I will finish it. It's got no character about it. Watch nisu I'm going to big that up later but not this however I've got 69 character to write before this can be posted so if you got this far save your time it's just childish and boring compared to the franchise. There done.

Author: nakrugt
Review_Title: 3 Wasps against Kang in Quantumania, ft. Ant-Man
Review: I am writing all this as a normie, I do not know anything about the comics and stuff. It is just a film.

Author: Harlekwin_UK
Review_Title: CGI heavy but that's to be expected given the subject matter
Review: First up, I'll say I seem to be in a minority that like this movie.

Author: jordyntsmith
Review: Any-Man and co. Go to the Quantum Realm, and save it, sort of?

Author: rdamian1963
Review: The MCU seems to be running out of steam in delivering really good movies. Not that this movie is bad, but it isn't all that good either. It has a solid cast, and decent acting. The script is a bit underwhelming making the movie just a bit too overtly silly. It just adds to the ongoing Disney mantra quantity over quality. There definitely was potential for a really solid movie. Yet it all just doesn't measure up. It all gets to be a mish-mash with loss of any real direction. It does somehow remain entertaining, despite its mediocrity. Perhaps, I just expect more from Marvel, although with it being under Disney, perhaps I should keep expecting less.

Author: BeastyBoyFlicks
Review_Title: This is a movie for 12 and under audiences only.
Review: This movie starts with a flashback scene, that should have been a 20-30min flashback that allows the audience to get to know Janet and Kang more intimately, allow us to "feel" more for the characters, as well as, deeply understand what 30 years in the Quantum Realm was like. I felt nothing for any character in this movie. The movie had no balance between humor and drama. Composed music was pretty lacking. However, anytime Kang was in a scene, the way he spoke and the tone of the scene felt really good. So disappointed in Marvel and the cast for allowing this movie to be made the way it was. Horrible writing.

Author: dominicbarnard-51903
Review: I was really happy with this kick start to Phase 5, we get so much face time with the new villain Kang the Conquerer, but with plenty room left to open the character up even more.

Author: trumstheconquero
Review_Title: The worst thing a movie can be at the theater is boring
Review: This film qualifies. The Antman and Wasp effects are handled routinely now so the superhero aspects aren't significant. The film has several quiet scenes of dialogue that are so drama and action free (no music either) they put you to sleep.

Author: rafamiko
Review_Title: Jonathan Majors scored all the points
Review: That's it. The movie started when Kang appeared, he's a really charismatic, determined and terrifying character, and Majors plays him perfectly, after all he's a fantastic actor. The rest of the movie, the writing, the fight scenes, the so-called climatic moments, went from bland to straight bad. THE CHARACTERS, my god. Except from Kang of course, the rest of them were apalling, horribly written and let's not even start with developed, from Scott to Modok, not even a single one of them was funny, relatable, realistic, they didn't feel like real humans with emotions.

Author: macronnel
Review_Title: Visually stunning, but its all been done before.
Review: This is a CGI, greenscreen heavy type of movie. I can only stand to watch for 30 minutes of this before tuning out (I was already struggling at 20 min). I understand that the setting is something of a different world, but its just nauseating, weird, tripping on acid type of strange world. I love all the actors as they are not given enough credit to use their imaginations as they interact with an empty space that is suppose to be an organism of some sort. The action scenes makes me even less invested in the movie as there is no real sense of danger. Like most super hero movies, they are very predictable. I'm sure I'm not within the target demographic of this movie and it's my fault for thinking it can be enjoyable for all ages. This is a kids movie that was intended to excite wonder and imagination so I will encourage anyone else over the age of 9 to skip this one.

Author: Ahmedfadil00
Review: Many will not like it.. who are in a hurry to finish the story always.. this movie is for those who want to enjoy quietly and slowly.. like food when it is cooked slowly.. I really enjoyed the movie.. the movie was successful in my opinion because when the two hours ended, I was shocked how it went Quickly.. I did not pay attention to the time.. The photography and the visual effects were very, very excellent.. The presentation of the character of Al-Ghazi was awesome, especially the first scene after the ending song. Very excited about the new part of the Avengers. It deserves the 9 stars.. I was hoping The end will be sad.

Author: samstersam
Review_Title: WHAT IN THE QUANTUM JUST HAPPENED? DISASTERCLASS!
Review: I swear a these god damn quantum ants need to get of my screen. Marvel let's it's self down once more. This was an acid trip of absolute quantum-nonsense. I can't express how angry the acting, the writing and the quantum ants made me. Someone needs to be fired and sent to the quantum realm because personally whoever is responsible for this should be out of my timeline.

Author: pumpelche-42068
Review: The Disney productions seem to have problems finding a nice balance between seriousity and near infantile joy and jokes. The topic itself, the Quantum Realm, whole Quantum Worlds, superior, incredible powerful beings that might even threaten Earth - pulled into ridiculousness framed with this never ending, often flat if not stupid kind of humor. Does some seriousness hurt? I could not finish the movie, it was too boring and too dumb. Dumbed down to a maximum audience it seems. Situative humor is amazing, but not if it's the carrying string throught the whole cello sonata. Unfortunately, the urge to produce more Marvel content obviously leaves story and immersion behind. And yes, infantile humors destroy immersion - in a movie about quantum realms.

Author: binayakpanda-14113
Review_Title: Disaster for the Marvel followers Not worth to watch
Review: Keeping spoilers away this movie is such a waste of time till now i am convincing my self that its a movie. The story runs around scot and cassie lang,there us much to explore quantum realm but i think janet kept it secret with marvel too hence they do not created that much fuss. Rather than calling it movie its a motivational video where you out number an enemy even though u r injured or less in number. At the end what they did to M. O. D. O. K is unacceptable by any marvel comic lover. The movie has a very few moments s to be appreciated rest its a time waste with the invested money also. Correct me if.

Author: kateAraya715
Review: I was only going to use this as background noise while I did some work.... I am so glad I stopped working and I'm even happier that this movie gave me a reason to. Just the visuals alone are so cool and setting up Kang's story (played by the enormous talent that is Jonathan Majors) brought the level of depth interest and talent for a Superhero movie to a whole new level. And that's says a lot when you're watching Michael Douglas and Michelle Pfeiffer on screen who -though they didn't - can just phone it in and it's still fun to watch. I loved the whole aesthetic of the film from the Quantum realm to Evangeline Lilly looking gorgeous as a beautiful woman sans a ridiculous amount of Botox and playing a SuperBadAss along w Michelle Pfeiffer.

Author: jason_kressen
Review: I hardly leave reviews but this latest MCU flop was flat out just a waste of my money. I haven't seen a Marvel movie in a while and really only went to go take my nephews to see it. As most have said, Kang is only positive in this but he's not nearly enough to save the film.

Author: smushsucks
Review: I think it was during Guardians 2 I thought to myself 'You know if Starlord just used the powers his dad gave him, he could just bring his mom back and end the movie without a final battle.' The simple act of having a Marvel superhero listen and communicate better would eliminate a lot of the frustration of foisting a big battle scene into the end of the movie.

Author: mjtothemax3
Review_Title: Cringey at best, but Kang is real
Review: After seeing how Kang was revealed in Loki I thought we were in for a real treat going forward anytime he showed up. Luckily Kang still was pretty good in this film but the problem is the rest of the film was so awful... The dialogue, the secondary characters, all of it was truly cringe-worthy and I feel like this was truly meant for young children to be watching this film. Now that Bob chapek is out at Disney I hope everything gets back on track because this film is the epitome of mediocrity at best. Don't get me started on modok as I'm sure everyone else felt the same way seeing how terrible that looked. Let's raise a toast that Jonathan majors continues as kang and that we hope the films become legendary once again going forward.

Author: cmarlborough
Review: Not sure what everyone's problem is- Marvel is moving on to a new storyline, if you don't like it then stop watching! I like the multiverse story- it brings a bit more depth to things. Love Paul Rudd and interested to see where they are going with the new villain. Also great to see Loki in the second end credit. Yes- you have to have Disney plus to really keep on track with the whole film/series split but I quite like that, give us all something to watch in between the films! And they do need to bring in the next generation so Cassie is a good addition to the crew.

Author: galant-38340
Review_Title: Don't waste your money on this one
Review: The first movie is quite original and then it went downhills for each sequel.

Author: ivoivo-31020
Review: This movie is total copy/paste from Rick&Morthy. The main vilan have citadel of vilans that locked away in quantium reality the most evel of them? I have watched this story before, but with much better action and better characters. If Justin Roiland and Dan Harmon don't address this ripoff then I don't know who will... Oh wait the YouTube channel Screen Junkies most likely. The movie have 3 old stars that play like they are in comedy and the main characters are uh.... I don't know. If I was 10 years old that will be super cool to watch with friends, but as adult is just bad. I know that main vilan is from different timeliness and multiverse and so on, but this is in Rick&Morthy years ago.

Author: tapus666
Review:
Marvel keeps spitting out movies to keep the wheels going. No good story or was none at all in this one. I sure felt like "what did I just see?"
Wasted two hours but at least I got to see a lot of cgi- yeah!!!

Author: txagestimator
Review_Title: An Ant-Man Fitting of the Trilogy
Review: A good stand-alone movie that was only enhanced with the prior viewings and knowledge of Ant-Man, Ant-Man & The Wasp, and Avengers: End Game.

Author: yessimonsir-90446
Review_Title: Lazy, boring and the worst Marvel film I've seen.
Review: No personal development of supporting characters. All CGI no real effort for development and Michael Douglas spent the whole moving stuffing a turkey.

Author: jpkaramanolis
Review_Title: The downfall of Marvel is sad to watch
Review: It's been a few minutes after i left the cinema and i still cant believe that was the introduction to Kang! That's the big bad guy we are supposed to fear in the future of the MCU?? What's wrong with Marvel lately? So, the movie was really good looking except a few awkward fight scenes and a god awful CGI face (those who have seen it know who i'm talking about)... The humour was fine but a bit tiring since the movie didn't know if it wanted to take itself seriously or not. There were so many scenes that got ruined because of out of place jokes that shouldn't be there, there were some boting and uninteresting side characters and side plots and it felt like they realised how bad the movie was when it was too late... Kang is ruined as a villain as well as the Avengers movies... The worst start for a phase in the MCU ever! I don't want to spoil anything so i can't say much, but overall a really bad film that had no direction.

Author: derrickweeks
Review_Title: A Butch Mom, Activist Daughter and a Socialist grandpa... What can go wrong?
Review: Really glad I didn't spend Money watching this movie. You couldn't get through the first 10 minutes without having PC shoved Down you throat. Got Cops tear gassing sweet innocent homeless people? Don't worry! Socialist Grandaddy can come teach you about how ants use socialism to thrive and prosper like a well oiled machine. I was surprised Cassie didn't blow a Vape cloud in her dads face for not being as good as an activist as she is. I would like to see the Chinese version of this because I would bet that it's much better than whatever this garbage is.

Author: Loafez
Review_Title: Don't let the low reviews turn you away...
Review: I never take time out of my day to write reviews for movies, but I feel like I had to write something for this movie considering how many bad reviews it's gotten. I thoroughly enjoyed this film, it has plenty of action, and the CGI is impeccable as always. Yeah, Modok's design is a little funky, but what else do you expect from a floating head? From the complaints I've heard, the majority of them lies on the character design of Modok, which in my opinion is a dumb thing to hate on the entire movie for. As the Antman movies progress, they start to lie more and more on his family and the people he loves, which I very much am intrigued by. So with that, if you're expecting a film about Paul Rudd, you're not going to entirely get that. This film does setup for bigger plots within the MCU, and I'd say is more of a prerequisite to watch before future films.

Author: bio_yamin
Review: Marvel is winning against DC in terms of which is going to produce non-stop trashes. I am feeling sorry that I had to write this for Ant-man because I liked the first movie and I like Paul Rudd. Kathryn Newton was great in Supernatural, where I first saw her. I expected that she would be good in this movie. But unfortunately she has been total bland. If Marvel has any respect for these characters they should just stop. Again we probably should not be surprised given that they kind of wasted all characters. Even Captain America after retirement into a peaceful life, they created a trash series. They should have killed all of heroes in End Game to save them. It's kind of what Harvey Dent said in the Dark Knight.

Author: bxuser
Review_Title: Poorly written, and a visual mess
Review: As the MCU moves into it's latest phase, the core universe's story revolves around very complex topics like time manipulation and multiverse travel. Two topics that have me personally, SO excited for their potential. The complexity of these topics requires more exposition, and frankly less absurdity to tell a story that's relatable and inserstandable. Quantumania, as well as Dr. Strange 2 falls very flat there... the only exception to this trend being the Loki TV series. In this review I'll compare the tone, writing, and visual language between Loki and Quantumania to give better context why the latest Ant Man qualifies as "truly forgettable" and "see only because you have to" for dedicated MCU fans.

Author: lukemtyner
Review_Title: On par with all the other recent Marvel movies
Review: Pretty average at best. Bland story filled with nothing but CGI. They should've used a different hero to introduce Kang. I get why, cause they had to travel to the quantum realm, but come on. Ant-Man, a character with no powers, against Kang, who is in the same league as Thanos. Leaves you just asking "Why?" and "How?" the entire time. Makes no sense. "I've destroyed multiverses and entire timelines" but then literally gets beat by some ants... ants. And sure, you could argue that this variant of him is weaker or restricted due to him being exiled, but even still, his technology is so powerful, so far beyond what we have on earth, he has telekinesis, he can create shields, he can incinerate beings, shoot lasers, amongst other crazy feats. But he was beaten by some ants... that's just lazy to me.

Author: marwinsingh-30063
Review: Ant man and the wasp quantamania is a big step up from previous two films in trilogy, it sets up future of MCU's Multiverse saga meanwhile providing a good entertainment.. Visuals were great, story was good , action scenes were enjoyable everyone delivered a great performance especially Majors as KANG THE CONQUEOR, Paul Rudd was also great as ant man like previous mcu apperances.. It had some pacing issues but an epic 3rd act makes up for everything.. Final battle was really amazing and was on a big scale it also had some tense moments.. There is also a little bit of comedy, some good jokes.. Overall film is great which concludes this trilogy in a small big way meanwhile setting up stages for mega event movies AVENGERS THE KANG DYNASTY and AVENGERS SECRET WARS.. This film also acts as an introduction of Kang who is the main big bad of phase 5.... In last I want to say you can enjoy this film in cinema as an fun superhero action adventure movie featuring our favorite Marvel heroes and villains you won't be dissapointed especially young kids will enjoy this film very much... And hardcore MCU fans like me can't miss this one as we love all marvel projects....

Author: AxelAzzopardi
Review_Title: Overstuffs its Runtime, Losing the Charm of the First Two Films
Review: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania may have been visually impressive, but it failed to deliver the same level of charm and emotional depth as its predecessors. The movie felt overstuffed, trying to cram too many plotlines and characters into its runtime without allowing the audience to fully process what was happening.

Author: jeo-95863
Review: The movie in question, which explores the concept of the multiverse, has left me feeling disappointed. It seems like Disney is more interested in milking the idea for all its worth than in actually crafting a well-written plot that makes sense. The result is a film filled with so many plot holes that it's hard to take anything that happens seriously.

Author: markacharya-24634
Review_Title: Limp sequel to two pretty decent in series
Review: Plot is somewhat week given the opening is quite a brief lapse of in time with second movie. The plot does not have a great deal of intricate sub plots in the quantum realm. A sequel buffered with a few extra supporting cast and very lame development of challenges in core bulk of movie. Some brief and interesting visuals with similarities to Valerian and Avatar and Xmen. The script lacks any real suspense or action and does not leave you feeling the Ant man plot has been explored and developed quite as eloquently as Thor or Iron Man movies. Overall worth a viewing just to see how Ant man evolves in the so called Marvel universe. The introduction of a new villain in the marvel universe does leave a number questions and clues which tie in with Dr Strange , so doesn't leave a great deal of imagination on where a sequel might lean towards. Overall seems as though production and execution are quite rushed with the volume of cgi effects across length of film and lack of real in depth exploration in quantum realm universe.

Author: christophersmooney
Review: Does it deserve 10 stars? No .... but 7 or 8 or 9 for sure. This movie is another solid edition to the MCU lineup ..... PERIOD.

Author: guilhermevieira-19536
Review: The movie has good battles and fights but wasted a really good chance to be the best of the trilogy considering Kang's as the villain. Instead of focus on antman and the wasp they've chosen to highlight Cassie's character and made it extremely annoying, although the screenwriters probably wanted to show a empowered young girl. Her lines were terrible all the way.

Author: mohafinearts
Review: One of the worst screen play in the series. It is ridiculous in many scenes, predictable. Many scenes even have conflicts with characters. The writers even could not make consistent characters and their abilities. In some scenes they have magical abilities and in some scenes they do boxing 😂.

Author: adnarish
Review: Using one of the weaker and more comedic characters in the MCU (Ant-Man; Paul Rudd) to set up one of the most menacing threats (Kang; Jonathan Majors) was an odd choice. Unsurprisingly, it doesn't really work. Ant-Man is hopelessly outmatched by Kang, and the day is eventually saved by a contrived series of events that all feel like lesser versions of similar tropes in other films; from speeches that inspire rebellions to sudden cavalry charges.

Author: damon-salvatore
Review_Title: More of a Kang and Janet: Quantumania
Review: Movie was good and thats the reason I gave it 8 stars coz its deserves for its action sequences and also movie sums up to be what its was built in sense of quantum realm and janets back story and her fear of quantum realm. But yeah somewhere in these antman got much less time than he should have got as its his movie. "My Personal Opinion." The one thing is that Kang wasn't shown at his full strength, or may be this variant of Kang...because they were making him the most power full villan after Thanos, it didn't seemed liked that but keeping AntMan against his did the work and the 2nd Credit scene just made it clear why was Kang shown weak, I'll not tell way coz that would spoil your fun and I'm not Tom Holland.

Author: deeformecreep
Review: This is the beginning to Marvel's phase 4 and it's a weak start.

Author: grantleclerc
Review_Title: Failure to launch quantum opportunity for MCU phase 5
Review: Huge disappointment as had high expectations. Marvel's recent releases haven't been fan-tastic and this is (another) missed opportunity to knock this movie out of the park. Tiring. Disney/Marvel have been trying to grow the franchise too quickly without larger storyline integration but rather a focus on actors and new characters... leaves the audience confused, story line disjointed and disconnected across media.

Author: davywatson
Review_Title: Hard to be a Marvel Fan now
Review: As a lifelong Marvel fan I always try to see the positive in all their work, the MCU has declined so much recently that it's very difficult, this movie is so bad, it's like it was written by someone who never even heard of Marvel. They really need to start hiring actual fans and people who care about the source material as writers, not hipsters who think they know it all. Kang was the highlight of the movie but even he was criminally underused and written badly. Things need to change. Big time. The MCU was to busy trying to pander to modern audiences they forgot how to make an enjoyable experience.

Author: brianlespoir
Review_Title: Phase 5 got off to a very good start.
Review: I'm not a fan, but still the best of 3 Ant Man movies, because I love the kind of Sci-Fi scenes they use, a mixture of Star Trek and Guardians of the Galaxy. Action packed and not a moment boring, but didn't meet my expectations.

Author: jennifertabor
Review: I wanted to like it. I really did. But apparently marvel can make up their own rules and previous stories don't matter. I found myself laughing at how ridiculous it was several times.

Author: evancartin
Review_Title: Ant-Man 3: When Imperfections Collide in a Stroke of Genius
Review: Oh, what a masterpiece we have in Ant-Man 3, courtesy of the brilliant Jeff Loveness. With utmost pride, he unveils his awe-inspiring ignorance and flaws, surpassing all records in creating characters that are irrelevant beyond imagination for the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). Kang the Conqueror, the debut penned by this wordsmith, how could we not be in awe? Truly, a shining example of the triumph of mediocrity!

Author: callumdignan
Review_Title: Ant-Man has 7 holes, this movie was pushed out by one of them.
Review: My review of this movie I'll get to in a moment but first I feel like i have to clarify something. Bit of a lengthy review this one so strap in.

Author: cescobedo325
Review: Maybe I'm just a sucker for a decent storyline, but this movie was at least fun. It had its funny and its visually appealing scenes like all MCU movies do. I'll just say that you could tell when they cut out chunks of the movie to save time, which isn't necessary and takes away from the film as a whole. I mean, if some of these MCU moves are 3-3.5 hours long, 2.5 hours isn't all that bad. I would say that it furthered the MCU and opens up new possibilities, but I've never read a Marvel comic (only DC) so I'm not the greatest source concerning what could come next. Also, Kang could have been a deeper character or at the very least we could have learned more about the variants and their history. Last, I couldn't help but get strong Tron vibes from this, which is fine and only excited me more for the upcoming Tron sequel. Definitely worth seeing, but not the best in the MCU lineup of movies.

Author: vivihuangca
Review_Title: It's like copying homework but getting a lower mark
Review: Let me just say that this movie didn't leave me with a good impression about Marvel.

Author: danielleeisacson
Review: Yeah, it's pretty bad.

Author: gfpvsgmby
Review_Title: This has to be the worst movie I have ever seen
Review: There is basically no plot and no read to watch this movie nothing happens of any value it doesn't add anything to the marvel universe besides kang the writers for this movie have to had dropped outta highschool to be this terrible at creating a story WARNING! Spoiler part they go into the th quantum realm kang is one if not the smartest person in all of marvel the whole movie he doe's absolutely nothing just watching his army get defeated sending henchmen while he has a hostage he does nothing with said hostage the smartest man currently in the multiverse who ever is heading marvel doesn't have a brain or chooses not to use it there is no real story such as in the shows animated movies or comics Kang does use his technology multiple times but he is called kang the conqueror why use that name when they have nothing worth showing.

Author: 18Buddha
Review_Title: Jesus so much Low raters.. why!?
Review: Theirs so much low ratings for this movie and it puzzles me why? I see alot of complaints about CGI & green screens & some complained its not creative & that its predictable n done before?? Lmao done before? Some harsh critics here.

Author: andresmendezsolis
Review_Title: A CGI theme park with little less more to offer.
Review: This movie has so many tone changes that leaves you confused as for what it really tries to offer. Is it comedy? Is it drama? It is of course comic-book sci-fi, that much is clear from the get-go, but it changes so abruptly its tone that you don't even know if you should feel sad or laugh for the characters when something happens to them. Every transcending event is diluted with humor to the point you feel nothing of importance actually occurs and it ends with little more than a TV series single episode adventure that can be completely forgotten by the next day. You have the cheap, shallow humor you can expect from Marvel, but that seems to be the essence, the "raison d'être" of this universe to the point these movies only offer you a two hour CGI excess with a storytelling that could be reduced to 20 minutes.

Author: Scarefish
Review: Well, they've finally managed it.

Author: aansara-67591
Review: So bad. An Ant-man movie where he's barely in the 1st 1/2. As in, don't even call it Ant-man. How about, "Ant-mans extended, super annoying family of self-absorbed narcissists where he'll show up for cameos now & then; oh, and his daughter will treat him like crap"

Author: unchunate-643-588780
Review_Title: A Fun Comic Book Movie. Nothing More, Nothing Less.
Review: I really don't understand the hate for this film. Is it going to be an Academy Award winner? Of course not. Is it a fun comic book story brought to life on the big screen? Yes, it certainly is. All the components are there. It's got some laughs and some heart. It's got a good, strong villain. There are strange life forms with cool tech and weaponry. And, there is plenty of over-the-top action, punches, and explosions. No, it isn't a complex, heady film, with a deep, meaningful message or plot. But, it doesn't need to be. It's exactly what it DOES need to be. A fun-to-watch bit of entertaining fantasy and escapism. What else could we ask for?

Author: nick-15926
Review: Felt like this movie was scripted by the democrats. Let's leave politics out of the MCU and get back to the basics. They are doing way too much with CGI and the story line. Let's keep it simple and let the acting carry the movie. You don't have to make the characters god like. The movies have gone down hill since end game. Let's go back to the basics which is what everyone loved. Just remember, CGI doesn't make a movie, the characters do. All the recent movies have gotten bad reviews and I don't know why they keep trying to change things and add their political influence to all the new movies.

Author: mranan
Review: This movie does a big heavy lifting for other franchises and this lead to a loss of focus , now I kind of understand where everything is going but this movie was something that is much about Kang than about Scott lang and as well as I can say rick and morty writers should be fired from marvel , they don't understand main characters and just doesn't develop the characters at all , you can develop Cassie lang but why don't you develop ant man as a hero just like Tony stark and captain America was. This movie is like if during infinity war saga there was a movie about character and instead of focusing on that character you focus on infinity stone how it was forged and came , you could have named this movie Kang and ant man just like you could have scarlet witch in madness for Doctor strange 2.

Author: cameronstacey-30501
Review: Desperately headed by an airbrushed cast of tired and uninterested actors, frantically attempting to provide some form of acting as they run around afront an unconvincing green screen more akin to sharkboy lava girl than a marvel film.

Author: SallyWilliams
Review: It's obvious that a bunch of Marvel "fans" are out to put everything down that's released. Me and my friends had a good time watching this movie. The ideas and designs of the Quantum Realm were epic fantasy. We just thought WOW. In some moments there was a little Star Wars flair. And the introduction of Kang The Conquerer and his motivations was delivered perfectly. Jonathan Majors delivered another Kang variant, and like He Who Remains, he nailed it. Another interesting take on the multiversal problems with evergrowing timelines and variants. The mid-credits scene was a lead-in to the next Avengers movie. The quartet of heroes were a fun team to watch. The only plot hole for me was Janet not telling her family about the great danger in the Quantum Realm. It's her fault that Kang got so mighty down there, and that the family experimented with it.

Author: melonhulkhead
Review_Title: Should not have been an Ant Man movie...
Review: Going into this movie I wasn't initially expecting much. I thought it would simply be a fun little adventure with solid comedy and enough action to please a 2 hour watch time. And yet I was somehow drastically disappointed.

Author: BlackXPanda
Review: Where to start, I was really looking forward to seeing this film, after 30 minutes I began to look at my watch. It was totally boring , no real story whatsoever. Only a handful of good moments mainly with the blobby thing and that's why it gets a 4 otherwise it would be lower.

Author: ankitajadon-39064
Review: Could've been a 15 min movie. Underwhelming visuals, poor dialog writing (did ChatGPT write dialogues for this movie?!), weak background score, did I say bad bad bad CGI already? Okay, would say it one more time to make my point and required character limit. And disappointing background score.

Author: jenakay
Review: I don't care what reviews say "Quantumania" was great. Funny, unique, action packed and filled with MCU call backs for real fans. I was SOOOOO disappointed with "Multiverse of maddness" and people loved that trash "Thor love and thunder" was a good movie that was forced to shoe horn in humor that derailed it and rushed the storyline. This movie (though the CG is EXTREME) was so cool and unique and a great way to kick of phase 5. If you watched and like the LOKI series you'll be very excited. Paul rudd is always amazing and Jonathan Majors kills it. Just think of this as a starwars otherworld story not grounded in our own and you can have fun, don't go in wanting to take it too seriously and it's a blast and feast for the eyes. Also the side characters are hilarious, on par with Ragnarok.

Author: ericgoldberg-50159
Review: This is the same Marvel movie Disney has pumped out over and over again. Visually nice but storywise not so much. The story starts off incredibly convoluted with the Quantum Realm being a dream land of ridiculousness. The movie is very slow until Kang the Conqueror shows up halfway through the movie. Jonathan Majors plays the part well. The only thing is we've seen a tyrant try to take over the universe and his name is Thanos. Thanos was supposed to be the most powerful being in the universe because he had the Infinity Stones but now Kang seems to be even more powerful for absolutely no reason at all. I'm getting tired of the same repetitive stories in Marvel movies and now there will be more with Kang being the next Thanos. Oh well. That's Disney for you.

Author: jamoo-59830
Review: I absolutely adore the Avengers fanchise but this was very difficult to watch.

Author: Jonas1969
Review_Title: Nothing deep about the Quantum realm
Review: Like most modern big budget action movies this is a beautiful movie, but most other aspects were pretty lame.

Author: wesleyarledge-86836
Review_Title: An Excellent, Fun, Weird, and Wacky Adventure Where The Stakes are High!
Review: Whew!! What a way for Marvel to start Phase 5 of the Marvel Cinematic Universe and The Multiverse Saga!! Ant-Man & The Wasp: Quantumania didn't disappoint! (Though there are two minor gripes I have with it that I'll get to in a moment).

Author: malcolmmckay-19016
Review: This movie is the most depressing thing I have seen in the theaters. No comedy very suicidal vibes. If you need to watch a new movie go back to the two original.

Author: davidchromydesigns
Review_Title: 2 Hours of mindless CGI. Terrible and pointless.
Review: The first ant man movies were funny, action filled and just fun to watch. Whatever this crap was, put me to sleep! What a train wreck of a movie. Who thinks making movies that have zero story, terrible acting, a script that sounds like a 3yo wrote it are good? Everything in this movie felt like a weak attempt to make a sequel. I guess the director and writer just had to ruin the first movies. I guess if you like watching a two hour videogame, with over acting and non stop green screen use, this will be the perfect movie for you! The attempts to inject humor into the script failed horribly.

Author: mbogich
Review: You're probably wondering (well, probably not, but maybe you are) if I had such low expectations for Ant Man and the Wasp: Quantumania, why did I go see it? The answer is simple, my brother and I were really, really bored, and he refused to see Puss in Boots 2. So, it's his fault really.

Author: gerrydax-78680
Review: Saw this today.

Author: jillsomeone
Review: Tired tropes stolen from far better original films - I felt like I was watching Wrath of Khan, John Carter, Star Wars and the Watchmen all at once.

Author: consumer-08498
Review: Marvel has has made a very few good movies: the 1st Guardians of the Galaxy, the 1st Doctor Strange, Eternals (which went largely unappreciated).

Author: lucasnicolasvasilescu
Review_Title: I cant defend the mcu anymore
Review: I have loves the mcu since i was a little kid, even when the movies/tv shows were considered bad i was there to defend them, i liked iron man 2. This movie is the peak of quantity>quality, the cgi is very bad, which isnt unusual for the mcu recently. The movie does not contain any character development whatsoever, the characters do not change or learn anything througout the movie, it feels like the movie was made for 5 year olds. The cinematography is bad but its marvel so it wouldnt be expected to be good (i dont really care about cinematography here tbh). The humor isnt as present as you would expect but even when its there it doesnt work that well, modok is a very bad comic relief, marvel studios have ruined his character. On the other hand, Kang as a villain works but the way he loves is just completely wrong, they did him so dirty, he's Kang the conquerer, he is supposed to be basically unbeatable, i still liked him as a character but it could have been done so much better. Even with all of this i still anjoyed the movie for what it was surprisingly enough. The post credit scenes were really great though, seeing Rama-Tut and Immortus felt good and that scene pulled straight out of the comicbooks was epic! The second post credit scene had me grappin my chair, Loki is back for a season 2 and we have (imo) a scene from it, it was amazing, Loki was definetly the best marvel studios tv-show.

Author: Smellman426
Review_Title: Solid Trip into the Quantum Realm
Review: This movie was good. I enjoyed it as much as I expected though it did not exceed those expectations. I have enjoyed the past two Ant-Man movies, but they have never been my favorites (at least compared to some others), but this was probably the best of the three. The story was kind of all over the place, but at the same time, it was simple enough to follow. The best part of the movie was definitely Kang. Jonathan Majors delivered a great performance and every scene that he was in was great. Looking forward to seeing more of the character in the future. Kind of disappointed with M. O. D. O. K., thought he was added just so there could be another character in the movie and Kang could have a comic relief but the two of them barely interacted and I feel like he could have been saved for the future instead of just getting killed off so soon, but I digress. Interesting to see Cassie get some new development and have her own suit, guess we will see more adventures with Ant-Man, The Wasp, and Stature in the future. Not much else to say. This was not my favorite Marvel movie, but not the worst I have seen either.

Author: imsulzer
Review_Title: Lots of Potential, but ran out of gas mid-flight and off trajectory
Review: Based off of the trailers, I was hooked and ready to see this film, especially with "the conqueror" being mentioned endlessly over and over again, and the amount of fear that was built up from 2 years ago with Season 1 of Loki.

Author: coynieuk
Review_Title: This film is the Kick Ass 2 for the Ant-Man Movies
Review: I liked Ant-Man and enjoyed Antman and the Wasp so I was very disappointed with this as I was hope full we could see a dysfunctional group of family friends come to gether to resole an important but not critical problem

Author: BionicStudios
Review:
Pros
-Jonothan Majors does his best with what he's got
